adjectives.description: polychromatic (comparative more polychromatic, superlative most polychromatic)

entries.meaning: Showing a variety, or a change, of colours; having many colours; multicoloured.
examples: With our water goggles adjusted we gazed at the fishes displaying their polychromatic scales to the sea world, as, with true Puka-Pukan languor, they finned from coral to coral.

entries.meaning: (physics, of electromagnetic radiation) Composed of more than one wavelength.
